fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class StorageSCP

Object
  SCP
      StorageSCP
public class StorageSCP
extends SCP

Implements a Storage SCP for receiving images through the network.

If a listener is specified in a constructor, the listener method is called when an object is received, within an association thread. If no listener is specified, the user must call receiveObject, which blocks until a object is received on any one association.

Calling receiveObject when a listener was specified in a constructor may lead to unexpected results.

The constructors accept two listener interfaces: StorageSCPListener is the simplest one. ReceivedObjectListener allows more control on what is sent back to the Storage SCU.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st)
           throws DicomException
Creates a storage SCP that will listen for store requests on the specified port when start() is called. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local address if addr is null. Objects received by a SCP created using this constructor must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to this SCP.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st,
                  StorageSCPListener listener)
           throws DicomException
Creates a storage SCP that will listen for store requests on the specified port when start() is called. The objectReceived method of the specified StorageSCPListener will be called when an object is received. The received objects must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to the ReceivedObject. A response is sent to the Storage SCU after objectReceived returns with a "success" or "warning" status code depending whether warning happened when receiving the object. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local address if addr is null.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st,
                  ReceivedObjectListener listener)
           throws DicomException
Creates a storage SCP that will listen for store requests on the specified port when start() is called. The objectReceived method of the specified ReceivedObjectListener will be called when an object is received. The received objects must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to the ReceivedObject. The objectReceived method has the option to modify the response to the Storage SCU before it is sent. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local address if addr is null.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
           throws IOException
Binds the TCP server if it has not already been done and starts to listen for store requests.

Called automatically by DicomReader when this StorageSCP is used as its input.

Throws:
IOException

stop

public void stop()
          throws IOException
Stops answering to store requests.

Throws:
IOException

receiveObject

public ReceivedObject receiveObject()
                             throws InterruptedException
Called by DicomReader when input is set to a StorageSCP. May also be called directly by user. The returned ReceivedObject may be set as an input of a DicomReader.

Throws:
InterruptedException
